Detailed Description

Macro Definition Documentation

#define PROTOHTTPSERV_FLAG_LOOPBACK   (0x01)

when set, only traffic from the same host will be accepted on the listen port

Typedef Documentation

ProtoHttpServHeaderCbT

Invoked when a new request header is received.

Parameters
*pRequest- [in/out] Information about the request we are going to process
*pResponse- [out] Used for handling the response, this allows us to error if header is malformed
*pUserData- User Specific Data that was passed into ProtoHttpServCallback
Returns
int32_t - positive=success, negative=error
typedef void( ProtoHttpServLogCbT)(const char *pText, void *pUserData)

logging function type

ProtoHttpServReceiveCbT

Invoked when new incoming data is received for a request.

Parameters
*pRequest- [in/out] Information about the request
*pBuffer- The data that was received (NULL when complete)
iBufSize- The size of the data received (zero when complete)
*pUserData- User Specific Data that was passed into ProtoHttpServCallback
Returns
int32_t - zero=no data processed, positive=amount of data processed, negative=error
typedef struct ProtoHttpServRefT ProtoHttpServRefT

opaque module ref

ProtoHttpServRequestCbT

Invoked when a request is ready for processing.

Parameters
*pRequest- Information that allows for processing of request
*pResponse- [out] Information that ProtoHttpServ used in responding to the request
*pUserData- User Specific Data that was passed into ProtoHttpServCallback
Returns
int32_t - zero=complete, positive=in-progress, negative=error
typedef struct ProtoHttpServRequestT ProtoHttpServRequestT
typedef struct ProtoHttpServResponseT ProtoHttpServResponseT
ProtoHttpServSendCbT

Invoked when outgoing data needs to be sent for the response.

Parameters
*pResponse- Information about the response we are sending
*pBuffer- The data we are writting to for the response (NULL when complete)
iBufSize- The size of the outgoing buffer (zero when complete)
*pUserData- User Specific Data that was passed into ProtoHttpServCallback
Returns
int32_t - positive=amount of data written, other=error

Function Documentation

DIRTYCODE_API void ProtoHttpServCallback ( ProtoHttpServRefT *  pHttpServ,
ProtoHttpServRequestCbT *  pRequestCb,
ProtoHttpServReceiveCbT *  pReceiveCb,
ProtoHttpServSendCbT *  pSendCb,
ProtoHttpServHeaderCbT *  pHeaderCb,
ProtoHttpServLogCbT *  pLogCb,
void *  pUserData 
)

set httpserv callback function handlers (required)

set httpserv callback function handlers (required)

Parameters
*pHttpServ- module state
*pRequestCb- request handler callback
*pReceiveCb- inbound data handler callback
*pSendCb- outbound data handler callback
*pHeaderCb- inbound header callback
*pLogCb- logging function to use (optional)
*pUserData- user data for callbacks
Version
12/11/2013 (jbrookes)

References ProtoHttpServRefT::pHeaderCb, ProtoHttpServRefT::pLogCb, ProtoHttpServRefT::pReceiveCb, ProtoHttpServRefT::pRequestCb, ProtoHttpServRefT::pSendCb, and ProtoHttpServRefT::pUserData.

DIRTYCODE_API int32_t ProtoHttpServControl ( ProtoHttpServRefT *  pHttpServ,
int32_t  iSelect,
int32_t  iValue,
int32_t  iValue2,
void *  pValue 
)

control function; functionality based on input selector

control function; functionality based on input selector

Parameters
*pHttpServ- reference pointer
iSelect- control selector
iValue- selector specific
iValue2- selector specific
*pValue- selector specific
Returns
int32_t - selector specific
Note
Selectors are:
        SELECTOR    DESCRIPTION
        'ccrt'      Set client certificate (pValue=cert, iValue=len)
        'ciph'      Set supported cipher suites (iValue=PROTOSSL_CIPHER_*; default=PROTOSSL_CIPHER_ALL)
        'idle'      Set idle timeout (iValue=timeout; default=5 minutes)
        'scrt'      Set certificate (pValue=cert, iValue=len)
        'skey'      Set private key (pValue=key, iValue=len)
        'time'      Set request timeout in milliseconds (iValue=timeout; default=30 seconds)
        'vers'      Set server-supported maximum SSL version (iValue=version; default=0x302, TLS1.1)
        'vmin'      Set server-required minimum SSL version (iValue=version; default=0x300, SSLv3)
Version
12/12/2013 (jbrookes)

References ProtoHttpServRefT::iClientCertLvl, ProtoHttpServRefT::iIdleTimeout, ProtoHttpServRefT::iRequestTimeout, ProtoHttpServRefT::iServerCertLen, ProtoHttpServRefT::iServerKeyLen, ProtoHttpServRefT::pServerCert, ProtoHttpServRefT::pServerKey, ProtoHttpServRefT::uDebugLevel, ProtoHttpServRefT::uSslCiphers, ProtoHttpServRefT::uSslVersion, and ProtoHttpServRefT::uSslVersionMin.

const char *  pName 
)

create an httpserv module

create an httpserv module

Parameters

iSecure- TRUE if secure, else FALSE
*pName- name of server, used in Server: header
Returns
ProtoHttpServRefT * - pointer to state, or null on failure
